item.title: Katrina Joy add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "You do not have to be good. You do not have to walk on your knees for a hundred miles through the desert, repenting. You only have to let the soft animal of your body love what it loves. Tell me about despair, yours, and I will tell you mine. Meanwhile the world goes on. Meanwhile the sun and the clear pebbles of the rain are moving across the landscapes, over the prairies and the deep trees, the mountains and the rivers. Meanwhile the wild geese, high in the clean blue air, are heading home again. Whoever you are, no matter how lonely, the world offers itself to your imagination, calls to you like the wild geese, harsh and exciting – over and over announcing your place in the family of things." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Katrina Joy add a quote by Charles Baxter
item.description: "When all the details fit in perfectly, something is probably wrong with the story." -- Charles Baxter

item.title: Katrina Joy add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Never be bullied into silence. Never allow yourself to be made a victim. Accept no one’s definition of your life; define yourself." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Katrina Joy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Katrina Joy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde
